arts.ttl: The lowdown on Bristol City 1 QPR 1 - Spectacular Smyth strike continues Rangers’ unbeaten run
arts.sum: QPR are unbeaten in their last six matches after drawing 1-1 at Bristol City on Saturday. However, QPR were arguably the better side following Smyth’s unusual goal and had a couple of breakaways that could have seen them win the game if executed better.

arts.ttl: QPR boss Cifuentes provides assessment of unbeaten run
arts.sum: “Otherwise, I’m not satisfied about having the expression we had today here, I’m not satisfied about the amount of injuries we have and I’m not satisfied about things we need to improve. And now an important moment of the season comes and we need to keep improving.”

arts.ttl: Marti Cifuentes explains reasons for QPR’s slow start in Bristol City draw
arts.sum: “The fact that we played on a bigger pitch, the way we need to shuffle and we need to arrive half a second [earlier into position] makes a difference against a team that moves the ball quick, and they could find the pockets so when we were trying to lock them in one side [to press] it was not easy to arrive to the pockets they created in the middle. QPR head coach Marti Cifuentes felt a lack of energy was the cause of his side’s underwhelming first-half display against Bristol City.

arts.ttl: Bristol City v QPR player ratings
arts.sum: How we rated the players. The post Bristol City v QPR player ratings appeared first on West London Sport.

arts.ttl: ‘We need help’ – Cifuentes insists QPR must not be fooled by recent upturn
arts.sum: Rangers reaction. The post ‘We need help’ – Cifuentes insists QPR must not be fooled by recent upturn appeared first on West London Sport.

arts.ttl: Liam Manning lifts lid on Max O'Leary reaction after error in Bristol City draw with QPR
arts.sum: Liam Manning admits he felt Max O'Leary should have stayed in his box instead of rushing out to challenge Paul Smyth in the lead-up to QPR's equaliser as Bristol City drew with Marti Cifuentes' side, but praised the keeper's reaction. Although Manning felt his keeper had made the wrong decision given the work of his teammates in the middle of the pitch, the 39-year-old revealed that O'Leary had already admitted his mistake in the changing room after the full-time whistle.

arts.ttl: Cifuentes hails Smyth following QPR wondergoal against Bristol City
arts.sum: So it’s not just about analysing at the end of the season his number of assists and his number of goals, but everything he gives to the team in terms of running in behind, his capacity to push the opposition backline lower because of his pace, and his capacity to drive because his work rate is excellent when we don’t have the ball. “The fact that when you analyse many of the line-ups of opponents [against QPR], and so many times they change who is playing left full-back because of the presence of Paul Smyth says a lot about what he contributes.

arts.ttl: Bristol City player ratings vs QPR: Jason Knight stands out as Max O'Leary error denies Reds win
arts.sum: Like he did in the comfortable win over Argyle a few weeks back, the left-back got into some really good positions going forward and dealt with everything thrown at him from a defensive standpoint. Was slightly loose in the tackle but added a bit of technical quality that helped the Robins get into some really good scoring positions.

arts.ttl: Bristol City predicted team vs QPR as Liam Manning faces Scott Twine dilemma at Ashton Gate
arts.sum: The former Derby man has been impressive on the whole since arriving at Ashton Gate, but his form has dipped slightly in recent weeks and having been replaced at half-time against the Black Cats it feels like this weekend would be a good chance to give him a much-needed rest. Manning will be boosted by the return of both Scott Twine and Ross McCrorie who are both in contention to start, but will be without Sinclair Armstrong with the former QPR forward set for a spell on the sidelines having been handed his first start in two months against the Black Cats last time out.
